channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DOJ arrests three people in connection with Minneapolis church protests
item.description: The DOJ has arrested at least two people in connection with protests at a Minneapolis church last weekend. One of the pastors is said to lead the local ICE field office.
item.content:encoded: The DOJ has arrested at least two people in connection with protests at a Minneapolis church last weekend. One of the pastors is said to lead the local ICE field office.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: A look back at Ruby Ridge â€” and why it's relevant today in Minnesota
item.description: More than 30 years ago, a standoff with a white separatist family in Idaho led to federal rules on deadly use of force. Some say Renee Macklin Good's death in Minnesota offers a similar opportunity.
item.content:encoded: More than 30 years ago, a standoff with a white separatist family in Idaho led to federal rules on deadly use of force. Some say Renee Macklin Good's death in Minnesota offers a similar opportunity.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Pentagon vows to end 'woke distractions' at military's independent newspaper
item.description: The editor-in-chief of Stars and Stripes responds to a Defense Department announcement that it will assume greater control over the military newspaper.
item.content:encoded: The editor-in-chief of Stars and Stripes responds to a Defense Department announcement that it will assume greater control over the military newspaper.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Death of a detainee at an ICE detention center in Texas is ruled a homicide
item.description: The El Paso County medical examiner classified the death of a 55-year-old Cuban ICE detainee as homicide.
item.content:encoded: The El Paso County medical examiner classified the death of a 55-year-old Cuban ICE detainee as homicide.
item.dc:creator: Angela Kocherga

item.title: Anti-ICE protest at Minnesota church leads to 3 arrests but no charges for a journalist
item.description: A prominent civil rights attorney and at least two other people involved in a protest that disrupted a church service have been arrested, Trump administration officials said, even as a judge rebuffed related charges against journalist Don Lemon.
item.content:encoded:
A prominent civil rights attorney and at least two other people involved in a protest that disrupted a church service have been arrested, Trump administration officials said, even as a judge rebuffed related charges against journalist Don Lemon.

(Image credit: Angelina Katsanis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Tens of millions of Americans brace for winter weather blast
item.description: A winter storm is expected to wallop a huge chunk of the U.S. from the southwest, into the Plains, the Deep South, and the eastern seaboard. Heavy snow, ice, sleet and freezing rain are forecast.
item.content:encoded:
A winter storm is expected to wallop a huge chunk of the U.S. from the southwest, into the Plains, the Deep South, and the eastern seaboard. Heavy snow, ice, sleet and freezing rain are forecast.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Jack Smith defends Trump investigations to House Republicans
item.description: Jack Smith's appearance before the House Judiciary Committee marked the first open testimony about his work after presiding over two federal criminal indictments of President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Jack Smith's appearance before the House Judiciary Committee marked the first open testimony about his work after presiding over two federal criminal indictments of President Trump.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Investigation links several of Trump's associates to mining interests in Greenland
item.description: As President Trump pursues a takeover of Greenland, an investigation links several of his associates to mining interests in the Arctic territory. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with journalist Kevin Hall.
item.content:encoded: As President Trump pursues a takeover of Greenland, an investigation links several of his associates to mining interests in the Arctic territory. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with journalist Kevin Hall.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Trump's EEOC strikes harassment guidance amid debate over transgender protections
item.description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission voted 2-1 to roll back the agency's 2024 harassment guidance in its entirety. The document gave employers information on what makes up unlawful harassment.
item.content:encoded:
The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission voted 2-1 to roll back the agency's 2024 harassment guidance in its entirety. The document gave employers information on what makes up unlawful harassment.

(Image credit: Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: The ICE surge is fueling fear and anxiety among Twin Cities children
item.description: Some families aren't leaving their homes as aggressive ICE operations continue in Minnesota, leaving their children confined and stressed. Across the Twin Cities, kids are anxious and afraid.
item.content:encoded:
Some families aren't leaving their homes as aggressive ICE operations continue in Minnesota, leaving their children confined and stressed. Across the Twin Cities, kids are anxious and afraid.

(Image credit: Evan Frost for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson
